questions.question_text_1: How many test cases are required to achieve predicate coverage over a predicate with n clauses?
question_texts: How many test cases are required to achieve predicate coverage over a predicate with n clauses?

questions.question_text_1: Suppose we need to test a program that takes a number of integers as input. The minimum and maximum numbers of integers to be input are 5 and 10 respectively. Identify the correct set of BVA (Boundary Value Analysis) test cases from the following options.
question_texts: Suppose we need to test a program that takes a number of integers as input. The minimum and maximum numbers of integers to be input are 5 and 10 respectively. Identify the correct set of BVA (Boundary Value Analysis) test cases from the following options.

options.option_text: Two test cases: (1) 5 integers as input and (2) 10 integers as input
Three test cases: (1) 5 integers as input, (2) 10 integers as input, and (3)7 integers as input
Five test cases: (1) 5 integers as input, (2) 10 integers as input, (3) 7 integers asinput, (4) 6 integers as input, and (5) 9 integers as input
Five test cases: (1) 5 integers as input, (2) 10 integers as input, (3) 7 integers asinput, (4) 4 integers as input, and (5) 11 integers as input

questions.question_text_1: Consider input space partitioning (ISP) for a program that computes the scholarship amount to be disbursed to the school students as presented in the table below, consisting of characteristics and blocks.
questions.question_text_2:
Consider input space partitioning (ISP) for a program that computes the scholarship amount to be disbursed to the school students as presented in the table below, consisting of characteristics and blocks. 
  Consider the base choice given below: grade = 9.6
attendance = 85%
gender = Male
What is the minimum number of tests (including the base choice) required to satisfy base choice coverage (BCC) criterion?
question_texts: Consider input space partitioning (ISP) for a program that computes the scholarship amount to be disbursed to the school students as presented in the table below, consisting of characteristics and blocks.

Consider input space partitioning (ISP) for a program that computes the scholarship amount to be disbursed to the school students as presented in the table below, consisting of characteristics and blocks. 
  Consider the base choice given below: grade = 9.6
attendance = 85%
gender = Male

questions.question_text_1: Consider the method below:
questions.question_text_2:
Consider the method below: 
  Consider the problem of finding a set of test cases which satisfies RICC for the method compute. Which of the following statements is true? Please note that the variable t needs to be re-written in terms of inputs in the second predicate to achieve various coverage criteria. We use the predicate x < y to represent t.
question_texts: Consider the method below:

Consider the method below: 
  Consider the problem of finding a set of test cases which satisfies RICC for the method compute. Which of the following statements is true? Please note that the variable t needs to be re-written in terms of inputs in the second predicate to achieve various coverage criteria. We use the predicate x < y to represent t.

options.option_text: We get some feasible pairs when predicate p = (t || z == 0) being true and alsowhen p = (t || z == 0) being false.
We get some feasible pairs when predicate p = (t || z == 0) being true. But nofeasible pairs when p = (t || z == 0) being false.
We get some feasible pairs when predicate p = (t || z == 0) being false. But nofeasible pairs when p = (t || z == 0) being true.
No feasible pairs when predicate p = (t || z == 0) being true, and also when p =(t || z == 0) being true.
